title: Linear momentum - speeds of three blocks

content.question: Three blocks slide along a horizontal surface, as shown. The masses of the blocks, as well as the magnitudes and directions of their momenta, are indicated in the figure. Which of the following correctly relates the speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> of the three blocks?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub A is greater than v sub C which is greater than v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub C is greater than v sub A, which is greater than v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub B is greater than v sub C, which is greater than v sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, v sub A equals v sub B, close parenthesis, is greater than v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, v sub A equals v sub B, close parenthesis, is greater than v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
